details: The script is a Slurm script that is designed to run on a high-performance computing (HPC) cluster. It uses the Slurm Workload Manager to allocate resources for the job.
The script requests one node with two GPUs, and sets a time limit of 24 hours. It also specifies that the job should use 6 CPUs per task.
The script uses several modules, including python-intel/3.5.2, CUDA/9.0.176, and cuDNN/7.1-CUDA-9.0.176, as well as the Intel compiler and OpenMPI.
The script runs a Python application called 'fcgrnn_train_cd.py' which appears to be related to training a neural network model.

The Python application takes a number of command-line arguments that specify the training parameters, such as the learning rate, batch size, and loss function. The script also specifies the directory where the model will be saved.
The script runs the Python application using the 'srun' command, which is a Slurm command that allows you to run jobs on the cluster.
